sectiondef.header: Scheduler App Entry Group Bit Masks

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command performs no other function than to increment the command execution counter. The command may be used to verify general aliveness of the Scheduler Application.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The SCH_NOOP_CMD_EID informational event message will be generated

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para: There are no error conditions for this command. If the Scheduler receives the command, the event is sent (although it may be filtered by EVS) and the counter is incremented unconditionally.

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
This command resets the following counters within the Scheduler housekeeping telemetry:
Command Execution Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDPC)
Command Error Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDEC)
Schedule Activities Success Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_ActSuccessCtr)
Schedule Activities Failure Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_ActFailCtr)
Schedule Slots Processed Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_SlotProcCtr)
Schedule Skipping Slots Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_SlotSkipCtr)
Multiple Schedule Slots Processed Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_MultSlotCtr)
Awoke in Same Slot Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_SameSlotCtr)
Corrupted Table Data Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_BadTblDataCtr)
Table Loads Successfully Verified Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_TblPassVerifyCtr)
Table Loads Unsuccessfully Verified Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_TblFailVerifyCtr)
Valid Major Frames Received Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_ValidMajorFrameCtr)
Missed Major Frames Received Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_MissedMajorFrameCtr)
Unexpected Major Frames Received Counter ($sc_$cpu_SCH_UnexpectedMajorFrameCtr)

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The SCH_RESET_CMD_EID debug event message will be generated

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para: There are no error conditions for this command. If the Scheduler receives the command, the event is sent (although it may be filtered by EVS) and the counter is incremented unconditionally.

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: This command is not inherently dangerous. However, it is possible for ground systems and on-board safing procedures to be designed such that they react to changes in the counter values that are reset by this command.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command enables a single activity in the Schedule Definition Table.

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
SCH_EntryCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The SCH_ENABLE_CMD_EID debug event message will be generated
Error Conditions
This command can fail for the following reasons:
Invalid Slot (Minor Frame) specified in the command
Invalid Entry ID specified in the command
Current state is neither Enabled or Disabled (i.e. - it is corrupted or empty)
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Command specific error event messages are issued for all error cases

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Criticality is dependent entirely on the contents of the Schedule Definition Table entry being enabled
SCH_DISABLE_CC, SCH_ENABLE_GROUP_CC, SCH_DISABLE_GROUP_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command disables a single activity in the Schedule Definition Table.

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
SCH_EntryCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The SCH_DISABLE_CMD_EID debug event message will be generated
Error Conditions
This command can fail for the following reasons:
Invalid Slot (Minor Frame) specified in the command
Invalid Entry ID specified in the command
Current state is neither Enabled or Disabled (i.e. - it is corrupted or empty)
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Command specific error event messages are issued for all error cases

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Criticality is dependent entirely on the contents of the Schedule Definition Table entry being disabled
SCH_ENABLE_CC, SCH_ENABLE_GROUP_CC, SCH_DISABLE_GROUP_CC

xrefdescription.para: Enable Group and/or Multi-Groups of Schedule Activities

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command enables a single group and/or a collection of Multi-Group Activities in the Schedule Definition Table.

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
SCH_GroupCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The SCH_ENA_GRP_CMD_EID debug event message will be generated
Error Conditions
This command can fail for the following reasons:
No Group nor any Multi-Group was specified in the command
No activities with the specified Group and Multi-Group was located
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Command specific error event messages are issued for all error cases

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Criticality is dependent entirely on the contents of the Schedule Definition Table entries being enabled
SCH_ENABLE_CC, SCH_DISABLE_CC, SCH_DISABLE_GROUP_CC

xrefdescription.para: Disable Group and/or Multi-Groups of Schedule Activities

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command disables a single group and/or a collection of Multi-Group Activities in the Schedule Definition Table.

detaileddescription.para:
Command Structure
SCH_GroupCmd_t Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The SCH_DIS_GRP_CMD_EID debug event message will be generated
Error Conditions
This command can fail for the following reasons:
No Group nor any Multi-Group was specified in the command
No activities with the specified Group and Multi-Group was located
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Command specific error event messages are issued for all error cases

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Criticality is dependent entirely on the contents of the Schedule Definition Table entries being disabled
SCH_ENABLE_CC, SCH_DISABLE_CC, SCH_ENABLE_GROUP_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command allows the operator to enable processing and synchronization of the Major Frame Signal to the processing of the Schedule Definition Table.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The SCH_ENA_SYNC_CMD_EID debug event message will be generated

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para: There are no error conditions for this command. If the Scheduler receives the command, the event is sent (although it may be filtered by EVS) and the counter is incremented unconditionally.

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: May cause a number of minor frames to be skipped when the major frame synchronization signal is received and acted upon.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command generates and sends the Scheduler Application's Diagnostic Telemetry packet.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_SCH_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The SCH_SEND_DIAG_CMD_EID debug event message will be generated

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para: There are no error conditions for this command. If the Scheduler receives the command, the event is sent (although it may be filtered by EVS) and the counter is incremented unconditionally.

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: None

briefdescription.para: Num Bytes req'd to store entry states in diag pkt (2-bits per entry rounded up to nearest 16-bit word)
